intro: Crepidopsis mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican crepidopsis, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are often finely divided, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
